title: Crown Princess Mary and husband Frederik Crown Prince of Denmark during three-day trip to Paris
text:
Crown Princess Mary of Denmark looked radiant as she stepped out alongside her husband Prince Frederik in Paris, today.

The Danish royal, 47, appeared in high spirits as she shared a smile with Frederik, 51, when in the French capital.

Looking both equally stylish, the couple were visiting the Grande Arche de la Defense building in the financial and business district in Puteaux, during their first day of the three-day official trip.

Putting on an elegant display, Australian-born Mary proved her fashion prowess in a blue midi-dress, featuring flared arms and a pleated skirt.

With a cinched waistline and delicate buttons running along the centre of the frock, the mother-of-four highlighted her enviably-slender physique.

The royal topped off the sophisticated ensemble with a pair of blue high-heels and a matching clutch.

Addling a little glitz to her look, Mary, who will become Queen of Denmark when Frederik ascends to the throne, donned an elegant pearl bracelet and complementing earrings.

Looking just as picture perfect, Frederik sported a smart navy suit and blue and white tie to match his wife.

The couple are in France to support the growth and position of Danish companies in the French market and promote relations between the two nations.

They will lead a business delegation consisting of approximately 50 Danish companies and business organisations that will take part in trade promotional campaign under the title 'Denmark and France – together for a better life and a sustainable future'.

Their visit comes after Tasmania-born Mary was made regent by Queen Margrethe this week - meaning she can perform duties as head of state when Margrethe is otherwise engaged.

The Danish queen, 79, is gradually handing over the reins to other members of the royal family, and Frederik, his brother Prince Joachim, and the Queen's sister Princess Benedikte are also official stand-ins for the monarch.
